message.content: This question requires some basic understanding of the habitats of skin bacteria. Skin bacteria live on the surface of our skin, including under our fingernails. When you cut off your fingernails, you are removing a part of the habitat where these bacteria live. Option (B) is unrelated to the habitat of skin bacteria. Option (C) refers to oral hygiene and is unrelated to skin bacteria. Option (D) refers to nose hygiene and is also unrelated to skin bacteria.

This question requires knowledge about the habitat of skin bacteria. Skin bacteria typically reside on the surface of the skin, including the nails. When you cut off your finger nails, you remove a portion of the skin where the bacteria reside, thus causing the bacterium to lose its habitat. Option (B) is incorrect because eating pepperoni pizza does not directly impact the habitat of skin bacteria. Option (C) is incorrect because brushing your teeth primarily affects the oral cavity, not the habitat of skin bacteria. Option (D) is incorrect because blowing your nose primarily affects the nasal cavity, not the habitat of skin bacteria.
